intro: Chomelia unioensis, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its seeds are encased in hairy pods that split open when mature to release the seeds. Chomelia unioensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
